Environmental.Waste Management & Recycling: Covers all issues related to refuse collection, including bin schedules, recycling protocols, street cleaning services, sanitation facilities, and complaints regarding fly-tipping or illegal dumping.
Environmental.Green Spaces & Natural Landscapes: Concerns the preservation of parks, green spaces, urban trees, greenfield sites, and natural landscapes. Excludes planning applications and land-use regulation (see Housing > Planning & Land Use).
Environmental.Flooding & Drainage: Addresses flood control, drainage failure, surface water flooding, and related hydrological infrastructure concerns.
Environmental.Sewage & Water Pollution: Covers sewage spills, sewage system failures, and general water quality or contamination concerns.
Environmental.Biodiversity & Animal Welfare: Concerns the protection of wildlife habitats, biodiversity loss, and the responsible treatment of domestic and wild animals. Excludes criminal acts of animal abuse or neglect (see Crime > Animal Cruelty).
Environmental.Activism & Community Action: Encompasses civic engagement related to the environment, including protests, petitions, and grassroots volunteer initiatives.
Environmental.Renewable Energy & Emissions: Focuses on renewable energy projects, low-emission zones, and emissions reduction policy. Excludes electric vehicles and sustainable transport (see Transport > Green & Future Transport).
Environmental.Climate Scepticism: Captures skepticism of climate change validity, opposition to net zero targets, criticism of the economic burden of green policies, and pushback against environmental regulations.
Environmental.Environmental Advocacy & Green Policy: Supports action on climate change, promotes renewable energy, endorses net zero commitments, and advocates for stronger environmental regulations and green investment.
Environmental.Nuisance & Environmental Health: Relates to sensory pollution, including excessive noise, fireworks, hazardous odors, and air quality issues affecting public health.
Environmental.Other Environmental: Any environmental concern not covered by the above categories.

Immigration.Anti-Immigrant Sentiment: Includes hostile rhetoric, hate speech, scapegoating, and exclusionary demands directed at immigrants or refugees.
Immigration.Policy & Political Critique: Focuses on government handling of borders, partisan debates, and criticism of political or media narratives regarding migration.
Immigration.Socio-Economic Impact: Addresses the perceived or actual effects of immigration on housing, public services, the job market, and local community demographics.
Immigration.Legal & Administrative Status: Covers the procedural aspects of immigration, including asylum claims, visa documentation, and the legal distinctions between migrant statuses.
Immigration.Humanitarian & Integration: Reflects supportive perspectives, including empathy for refugees, advocacy for legal migration pathways, and the celebration of cultural diversity.
Immigration.Identity & Terminology: Discussions centered on the definition of immigration terms, national identity, and the historical context of migration.
Immigration.Other Immigration: Any immigration-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Housing.Homeowner Affordability & Market Economi: Concerns the financial aspects of home ownership, including mortgage rates, property prices, stamp duty, house buying challenges, negative equity, and economic policies affecting the property market.
Housing.Tenant Affordability & Market Economics: Concerns the financial aspects of renting, including rent levels, rent increases, deposit costs, rental market competition, housing benefit adequacy, and economic pressures affecting tenants.
Housing.Planning & Land Use: Focuses on the regulatory process of development, including council permissions, greenbelt usage, community consultation on proposed developments, and the environmental footprint of new builds.
Housing.Tenancy & Landlord Relations: Covers the rental experience, including repair disputes, eviction concerns, lease agreements, and landlord conduct.
Housing.Homelessness & Welfare: Addresses housing insecurity, emergency accommodation, rough sleeping, and social support for those without stable shelter.
Housing.Architectural Heritage: Relates to the protection of historic buildings, listed structures, local landmarks, and the emotional connection to established architectural character. Excludes intangible local history and traditions (see Cultural issues > Local History & Traditions).
Housing.Construction Standards: Focuses on the physical quality of housing, including safety hazards, workmanship defects, and maintenance delays in new or existing stock.
Housing.Development Motives & Design: Critiques the aesthetic quality of new developments and the perceived prioritization of profit over community needs.
Housing.Political Accountability: Directs blame or requests for action toward local councils and politicians regarding housing promises and policy failures.
Housing.Fraud & Malpractice: Captures unethical behavior, including rental scams, fake listings, and dishonest practices by agents or developers.
Housing.Infrastructure Impact: Discusses the strain placed on local amenities, transport, and services by increased housing density.
Housing.Council Housing & Allocations: Addresses the provision, maintenance, and allocation of council and social housing stock, including waiting lists and tenant services.
Housing.Other Housing: Any housing issue not covered by the above categories.

Democracy.Voter Participation: Focuses on the act of voting, including turnout encouragement, voter apathy, and skepticism about the value of the individual vote.
Democracy.Leadership & Party Critique: Targets the performance, integrity, and accountability of specific politicians, parties, and the broader political establishment.
Democracy.Electoral Integrity: Concerns the mechanics of elections, including transparency, procedural fairness, and the administration of polling.
Democracy.Systemic Reform: Advocates for major changes to the political system, including anti-establishment sentiments and calls to overhaul institutions. Excludes discussion of Reform UK (see Democracy > Leadership & Party Critique).
Democracy.Campaigns & Media: Critiques political messaging, campaigning tactics, media bias, and the manipulation of public discourse.
Democracy.Democratic Values: Reflects on the principles of democracy, rights, and the gap between democratic ideals and institutional reality.
Democracy.Other Democracy: Any democracy-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Local Government.Council Administration & Governance: Critiques the responsiveness, transparency, communication, and administrative competence of local councils and authorities.
Local Government.Local Facilities & Services: Focuses on the provision and maintenance of local authority facilities, including parks, libraries, leisure centres, and communal spaces. Excludes road infrastructure (see Transport > Road Infrastructure & Maintenance) and flooding or drainage (see Environmental > Flooding & Drainage).
Local Government.Local Representation & Elections: Addresses the effectiveness of local councillors, ward representation, council elections, and the fairness of electoral boundaries. Excludes general electoral procedure and integrity concerns (see Democracy > Electoral Integrity).
Local Government.Council Tax & Spending: Concerns council tax levels, budget allocations, spending transparency, the impact of budget cuts and political decisions on service quality, and the perceived value for money from local authority finances.
Local Government.Public Consultation & Engagement: Relates to how councils communicate with and involve residents in decision-making, including public meetings, consultations, and access to information.
Local Government.Outsourcing & Contracts: Critiques the awarding, management, and performance of council contracts to private companies and the quality of outsourced public services.
Local Government.Other Local Government: Any local government issue not covered by the above categories.

Economy.Utilities & Energy Bills: Focuses on gas, electricity, and water charges, including supplier disputes, metering issues, and service interruptions or failures. Excludes broadband (see Technology > Connectivity).
Economy.Food & Grocery Inflation: Concerns the price of consumables, shrinkflation, and discrepancies in retail pricing.
Economy.Public Fees & Levies: Addresses government-imposed costs, such as service charges, fines, and the impact of austerity on personal finances.
Economy.Income Disparity: Contrasts stagnant wages or income against the rising cost of essential goods and services.
Economy.Consumer Value: Critiques the declining quality of goods and services in relation to their increasing prices.
Economy.Fiscal Policy & Corporate Conduct: Critiques tax policies, government spending debts, and corporate profit-seeking behaviors. Excludes personal tax fairness and tax system reform (see Tax > Policy & Fairness).
Economy.Employment & Labour: Addresses the job market, wage levels, contract security, and working conditions. Excludes individual job vacancies, recruitment posts, and business self-promotion (see Businesses > Employment & Promotion).
Economy.Banking & Cash Access: Focuses on the availability of financial services, including branch closures, face-to-face banking access, and cash access points. Excludes digital payment systems and cashless technology (see Technology > Digital Payments).
Economy.Economic Infrastructure: Relates to physical developments that drive economy, such as transport hubs, commercial property, and urban renewal. Excludes strain on local services caused by housing density (see Housing > Infrastructure Impact).
Economy.Consumer Protection: Covers hidden fees, exploitative pricing, and unethical business practices. Excludes scams and fraud (see Crime > Fraud & Deception).
Economy.Postal & Delivery: Relates to the reliability and accessibility of mail services and parcel delivery networks.
Economy.Other Economy: Any economic issue not covered by the above categories.

Crime.Property Offenses: Includes burglary, theft, vehicle break-ins, vandalism, and criminal damage to property.
Crime.Violent Crime: Covers physical assaults, weapon use, and aggressive acts resulting in bodily harm.
Crime.Fraud & Deception: Relates to scams, identity theft, and financial trickery, both online and offline.
Crime.Policing & Response: Critiques the speed, effectiveness, and visibility of law enforcement and emergency response services.
Crime.Anti-Social Behavior: Focuses on public disorder, youth loitering, intimidation, and drug-related nuisance.
Crime.Animal Cruelty: Concerns abuse, neglect, or violent acts involving animals.
Crime.Moral Condemnation: Expressions of outrage and judgment directed at criminals or specific acts.
Crime.Systemic Causes: Links crime to broader political failures, social inequality, or lack of resources.
Crime.Victim Support: Focuses on justice, empathy, and solidarity with those affected by criminal acts.
Crime.Other Crime: Any crime-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Businesses.Consumer Feedback: General reviews of businesses, covering satisfaction with service, quality, or ambiance.
Businesses.Pricing & Payments: Focuses on cost-related complaints, value for money, and payment method issues. Excludes digital payment technology and cashless systems (see Technology > Digital Payments).
Businesses.Business Dynamics: Observations on business openings, closures, rebranding, operational changes, the shift to online retail, and high street revitalization.
Businesses.Local Identity: Relates to the support of independent shops, heritage businesses, and community character.
Businesses.Trust & Integrity: Warnings about poor workmanship and dishonest trading practices. Excludes scams and fraud (see Crime > Fraud & Deception).
Businesses.Employment & Promotion: Covers job vacancies, recruitment, and business self-advertising.
Businesses.Access & Infrastructure: Concerns external factors affecting businesses, such as parking, traffic, and fuel availability. Excludes general road safety, traffic regulation, and transport policy (see Transport).
Businesses.Other Businesses: Any business-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Technology.Connectivity: Focuses on broadband speeds, costs, and supplier disputes, mobile network signal, and internet reliability.
Technology.Digital Payments: Addresses the shift to cashless systems, digital wallets, transaction fees, digital payment failures, and transaction friction. Excludes bank branch closures and cash access points (see Economy > Banking & Cash Access).
Technology.Automation: Concerns the replacement of human staff with kiosks, AI, and self-service technologies, including reduced human interaction in commerce.
Technology.Smart Devices: Relates to the functionality and reliability of IoT, smart meters, and home security tech.
Technology.Surveillance: Debates the use of CCTV, facial recognition, drones, and privacy implications.
Technology.Future Mobility: Focuses on autonomous driving, delivery robots, and other emerging mobility technologies. Excludes general electric vehicle infrastructure (see Transport > Green & Future Transport).
Technology.User Experience: Critiques the design, glitches, and usability of apps, digital platforms, online government portals, and public service applications.
Technology.Cybersecurity: Concerns online safety, hacking, data breaches, and digital fraud protection. Excludes scams, identity theft, and financial fraud (see Crime > Fraud & Deception).
Technology.Adoption & Resistance: Reflects on the social impact of rapid tech change, including nostalgia for analog methods.
Technology.Online Discourse: Focuses on social media behavior, censorship, and the spread of misinformation. Excludes political campaigning tactics and election-related media bias (see Democracy > Campaigns & Media).
Technology.Other Technology: Any technology-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Cultural issues.Local History & Traditions: Reflections on local history, nostalgia, community traditions, and oral heritage. Excludes physical buildings and architectural preservation (see Housing > Architectural Heritage).
Cultural issues.Diversity & Inclusion: Discussions on race, religion, gender, and the politics of identity and representation. Excludes immigration-specific identity and terminology debates (see Immigration > Identity & Terminology).
Cultural issues.Urban Transformation: Debates the impact of modernization and development on community character. Excludes critique of specific housing developments (see Housing > Development Motives & Design).
Cultural issues.National Identity: Focuses on symbols, flags, patriotism, and media narratives about the nation.
Cultural issues.Discourse Tone: Captures the style of cultural debate, including humor, satire, and incivility.
Cultural issues.Art & Aesthetics: Evaluations of public art, graffiti, and the visual culture of the environment.
Cultural issues.Social & Entertainment: Concerns the cultural value of venues, festivals, nightlife, and social hubs.
Cultural issues.Public Behavior: Addresses etiquette, safety, and social norms in shared community spaces.
Cultural issues.Other Cultural Issues: Any cultural issue not covered by the above categories.

Education.School Experience: Personal accounts of school life, teacher quality, and academic satisfaction.
Education.Governance & Policy: Critiques funding, curriculum, political decisions, and administrative rules.
Education.Special Needs Support: Focuses on provisions and challenges for students with SEN and EHCP requirements.
Education.Safety & Facilities: Concerns the physical condition of schools and safety during the school run.
Education.Family Engagement: Relates to parental involvement, homeschooling, and communication with schools.
Education.Extracurriculars: Covers non-academic activities, clubs, sports, and teacher appreciation.
Education.Vocational & Adult Learning: Focuses on apprenticeships, career training, and continuing education.
Education.Community Context: Addresses how local planning and housing affect school capacity and access.
Education.Other Education: Any education-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Transport.Road Infrastructure & Maintenance: Concerns the physical state of road surfaces, potholes, signage, street lighting, roadworks, and highway upkeep. Excludes flooding and drainage (see Environmental > Flooding & Drainage).
Transport.Road Safety & Driving: Addresses driving standards, speeding, dangerous driving, road traffic accidents, illegal parking, vehicle-related misconduct, and the safety of pedestrians, cyclists, and other vulnerable road users.
Transport.Rail Services: Focuses on train services, rail network reliability, delays, cancellations, overcrowding, station facilities, fares, and rail infrastructure such as tracks and crossings.
Transport.Bus Services: Covers local and regional bus routes, service frequency, reliability, cancellations, fares, bus stops, and the impact of route changes or cuts on communities.
Transport.Aviation & Airports: Relates to air travel, airport operations, flight availability, airline service, airspace issues, airport expansion, and aircraft noise affecting local communities.
Transport.Policy & Governance: Critiques transport funding, fares, fuel costs, planning, regulations, parking enforcement, and political decision-making across all transport modes.
Transport.Green & Future Transport: Relates to cycling infrastructure, electric vehicle charging, sustainable mobility, and emerging transport technologies.
Transport.Other Transport: Any transport-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Health.Access to Care: Focuses on waiting times, appointment availability, service quality, and access to GPs, hospitals, and emergency care.
Health.Pharmacy & Dental: Concerns the specific availability and cost of dental care and medication.
Health.Systemic Policy: Critiques government funding, privatization, and management of the health service.
Health.Mental Wellbeing: Addresses mental health struggles, support services, and community care.
Health.Preventive Health: Relates to lifestyle advice, screenings, vaccinations, and public health campaigns.
Health.Marginalised & At-Risk Groups: Focuses on the specific health needs of marginalised and at-risk populations, including the elderly, disabled people, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with addiction, and sex workers. Excludes children's health (see Childcare and family > Child Health).
Health.Veterinary Care: Concerns the health, treatment and medication costs, and welfare of pets.
Health.Social Care: Focuses on support services for the elderly, disabled, and vulnerable populations.
Health.Other Health: Any health-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Childcare and family.Early Years Care: Focuses on nurseries, childminders, breastfeeding support, and school entry.
Childcare and family.Parenting Challenges: Relates to work-life balance, social judgment, and the struggles of raising children.
Childcare and family.Child Health: Concerns access to pediatric medical care and diagnosis of developmental issues.
Childcare and family.Safety in Public: Addresses road safety, stranger danger, and bullying risks for children.
Childcare and family.Support Networks: Focuses on government aid, charities, and community groups helping families.
Childcare and family.Family Dynamics: Reflects on relationships, domestic challenges, and family traditions.
Childcare and family.Other Childcare & Family: Any childcare or family-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Tax.Vehicle & Road Tax: Focuses on car taxation, MOT compliance, and parking enforcement revenues.
Tax.Administration: Concerns interactions with tax authorities, including refunds, probate, and system errors.
Tax.Policy & Fairness: Debates the equity of the tax system, government spending, and political promises. Excludes corporate tax avoidance and government debt (see Economy > Fiscal Policy & Corporate Conduct).
Tax.Compliance & Evasion: Addresses tax avoidance, fraud, and the ethics of financial contribution.
Tax.Economic Burden: Relates taxation levels to the broader cost of living crisis and financial stress.
Tax.Satire & Humor: Captures ironic or humorous commentary regarding tax obligations.
Tax.Other Tax: Any tax-related issue not covered by the above categories. Excludes council tax (see Local Government > Council Tax & Spending).

Pensions.Policy & Rules: Focuses on retirement age, eligibility criteria, and tax implications for pensioners.
Pensions.Administration: Concerns payment delays, errors, and the accessibility of pension services.
Pensions.Economic Reality: Addresses the adequacy of pension income relative to inflation and living costs.
Pensions.Political Context: Critiques the use of pensioners in political rhetoric and voting strategies.
Pensions.Social Aspects: Relates to retirement lifestyle, community support, and age-related concessions. Excludes formal social care services for the elderly (see Health > Social Care).
Pensions.Inequality: Debates the wealth gap between generations and different types of pension schemes.
Pensions.Fraud Risks: Warnings about scams specifically targeting pension funds and retirees. Excludes general scam and fraud discussion (see Crime > Fraud & Deception).
Pensions.Other Pensions: Any pension-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Benefits.Stigma & Perception: Addresses social attitudes, fraud accusations, and moral judgments of recipients.
Benefits.System & Process: Concerns the bureaucracy of applying for benefits, including delays and errors.
Benefits.Advice & Eligibility: Provides guidance on navigating the welfare system and accessing entitlements.
Benefits.Policy & Politics: Critiques government management of the welfare state and social safety nets.
Benefits.Charity & Aid: Focuses on food banks and community initiatives supplementing state support.
Benefits.Economic Hardship: Relates benefit levels to the reality of poverty and the cost of living.
Benefits.Lived Experience: Personal narratives of the emotional and practical impact of relying on benefits.
Benefits.Other Benefits: Any benefits-related issue not covered by the above categories.

Foreign issues.Conflict & War: Focuses on active international conflicts, humanitarian crises, and military actions.
Foreign issues.Aid & Spending: Debates the allocation of funds to foreign aid versus domestic needs.
Foreign issues.Nationalism & Identity: Reflects on domestic prioritization, xenophobia, and national interests. Excludes domestic patriotic symbols and cultural expressions of national identity (see Cultural issues > National Identity).
Foreign issues.Diplomacy & Leadership: Critiques government foreign policy, international relations, and leadership.
Foreign issues.History & Context: Draws parallels between current events and historical or colonial precedents.
Foreign issues.Media & Narrative: Critiques the framing, bias, and accuracy of international news coverage.
Foreign issues.Military Developments: Observations on military hardware, exercises, and future conflict speculation.
Foreign issues.Global Solidarity: Expressions of support for international communities and diaspora identities.
Foreign issues.Other Foreign Issues: Any foreign issue not covered by the above categories.

Non-specific.Non-specific: Not enough information to choose a category
